race.name: UNBOUND GRAVEL 100
race.tagline: The little sibling that still kicks your ass. 100 miles of Flint Hills gravelâ€”all the suffering, half the existential crisis.

climate.primary: Kansas summerâ€”extreme heat, humidity, thunderstorms possible
climate.description: Late May/early June in Kansas means 85-95Â°F highs with high humidity. Full sun exposure on open prairies. Thunderstorms are a perennial threat. The 2023 edition saw brutal mud conditions in the morning. 'Whatever brutal weather Kansas decides to serve up.'

terrain.primary: Flint Hills gravelâ€”sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits
terrain.surface: ~90% unpaved chunky flint rock roads, ~10% paved transfers. Sharp stones slice sidewalls. Clay mud when wet becomes 'peanut butter' that stops bikes.

logistics.explanation: Emporia is smallâ€”hotels book out fast after lottery results. Kansas City airport is ~2 hours away. Sheri Rosenbaum noted the "insanity that ensued during the first 15-20 miles" with crashes and chaotic positioning among 1,700+ riders. The mass start creates logistical challenges but the town embraces race week despite tight accommodations.

length.explanation: Actually 108.5 miles in 2025, with elite finishers around 5 hours but mid-pack facing 7-10 hours. Ayano Makoto described cramping "more than 20 times that day" and crying out "in agony every time" during his sub-6-hour effort. The distance alone doesn't break you, but combined with Flint Hills terrain it becomes a serious day in the saddle. Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

technicality.explanation: Opening 20 miles are "flat and fast" with "relatively tame" gravel roads, but notorious flint rocks remain brutal on equipment. Ayano Makoto found success "using the grassy inside line on corners" since "there are a lot of 90Â° turns" where inexperienced gravel riders "slow down a lot." Line selection matters more than MTB skills. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: ~4,000ft of climbing across the rolling Flint Hills. Marley Blonsky noted entering "the rolling hills of the Flint Hills" made the ride "more challenging physically" once riders enter the Flint Hills. The terrain features relentless undulationâ€”no big peaks, just punchy climbs that accumulate to grind riders down over the full distance. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: Kansas late spring brings extreme conditions. 2025 race day hit 90Â°F after a week of flooding rains and "flood alerts." 2023 saw sticky "peanut butter mud" that stopped riders for over an hour. Kris Cordova faced dehydration by mile 70: "I had a headache and started to feel lightheaded, then nauseated, as the heat of the day rose." Milder conditions than Crusher in the Tushar.

altitude.explanation: Emporia sits at ~1,200ft elevationâ€”oxygen abundant. The opening pace averages "37 km/h during the first hour" feeling "like a road race" according to Ayano Makoto. Sea-level athletes have zero disadvantage here. The challenge is heat, humidity, flint rocks, and terrainâ€”not thin air. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds â€” no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The Flint Hills provide stunning big sky country across America's last tall-grass prairie. Kris Cordova described the 2023 mud sections as pure "Adventure!" despite walking for miles through unrideable conditions. Water crossings before Council Grove and the remote ranch roads through wildflower country create lasting memories beyond just the racing.

prestige.explanation: Elite pros like two-time champion Tiffany Cromwell and Isaac Allred race the same terrain as everyday gravel fans in the same mass start. The Unbound name carries the "Super Bowl of Gravel" prestigeâ€”1,700 riders rolling out together from Commercial Street under police escort. Your finisher medal means something in gravel circles worldwide.

race_quality.explanation: Life Time runs a professional operation with mass start police escort, neutral mechanics, and one well-stocked checkpoint at Council Grove. However, the early miles feature "several crashes" among the "large pack of amateur racers" according to Sheri Rosenbaum. Cutoffs are strictly enforced at 10 mph pace for safety across remote terrain.

experience.explanation: The 6 AM mass start rolling 1,700 riders out of downtown Emporia creates the defining gravel experience. Suffering through flint-strewn roads, the iconic Highland Hill climb, and Commercial Street finish with roaring crowds. You earn your storyâ€”Marley Blonsky called it meeting "very fit (and cool) looking cyclists" in an atmosphere of shared adventure.

community.explanation: Emporia transforms into "Gravel City" with the town's population swelling 50% during race week. Pre-race, Marley Blonsky found immediate welcome: "I was recognized almost immediately and any nerves I had melted away, as we all introduced ourselves." The shared suffering of mud walks and heat creates lasting bonds among 12,000+ visitors.

field_depth.explanation: Strong elite field with pros like Tiffany Cromwell (2-time champion), Isaac Allred, and Hayden Christian. The 2025 men's finish came down to a sprint between Christian and Allred, with Christian winning after Allred "went too early." Sprint finishes are common among top contenders, though not quite the full elite depth of the 200-mile event. Deeper field than most â€” comparable to Badlands.

value.explanation: ~$245 entry is reasonable for a top-tier event with proper festival atmosphere, professional support, and the Unbound prestige. You get more than your money's worth in experience.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $245. Emporia is affordable if you secure lodging, but housing costs spike during race weekend with 12,000+ visitors flooding the small town. Flights to Kansas City plus 2-hour drive add up. Equipment mattersâ€”riders run specific setups like Panaracer Gravelking X1 45s at calculated PSI and carry essential tools like tire plugs and Super Glue for the brutal flint rocks. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

biased_opinion.summary: The 100 is designed as a launchpad to the 200â€”and it delivers. All the Flint Hills suffering, the Unbound atmosphere, the iconic finish, but in a (slightly) more digestible package. You'll still get humbled by Kansas. You'll still earn your finisher glass. And you'll probably start eyeing the 200 the moment you cross Commercial Street.
strengths: Manageable distance for first-timers to Unbound
weaknesses: Kansas weather can still be brutal
May feel like 'the other race' compared to 200
biased_opinion.bottom_line: If you want the Unbound experience without committing to 200 miles of suffering, the 100 is perfect. It's still hard enough to break you, but you'll finish before dark.

black_pill.title: THE FLINT WILL FIND YOUR WEAKNESS
black_pill.reality: The 100 is 'just half' the 200, but Kansas doesn't care about your math. The same tire-slicing flint rocks. The same peanut butter mud. The same relentless heat. Elite times are under 5 hours, but many riders face 8-10 hour days. You only get ONE checkpointâ€”that's 50+ miles of self-sufficiency each way. When the mud hits or the heat spikes, 100 miles feels like 200.
consequences: Flat tires happen constantlyâ€”multiple riders fixing flats at every descent
Only one checkpoint means you carry everything for 50+ miles
The 10-hour cutoff is strictâ€”pace wrong and you're pulled
Heat can exceed 100Â°F in the afternoon when you're most depleted
black_pill.expectation_reset: Run 40mm+ tubeless tires with robust casings. Carry multiple spare tubes, plugs, and a pump. Train in heat and humidity. Pace conservativelyâ€”the Flint Hills punish ego. Have a rain/mud plan. Expect something to go wrong. The finish line party makes it worth it.

final_verdict.one_liner: All the Unbound prestige, all the Kansas suffering, half the distanceâ€”still not easy.
final_verdict.should_you_race: Yes if you want the world-class Unbound experience in a (relatively) more accessible package. Yes if you're building toward the 200. Skip if lottery entry or Kansas weather are deal-breakers.
final_verdict.alternatives: Unbound 200 (the full experience); SBT GRVL (Colorado scenery, better weather); Gravel Worlds (Nebraska alternative)

logistics.airport: KCI (Kansas City) - 2hr drive to Emporia; ICT (Wichita) - 1.5hr drive
logistics.lodging_strategy: Hotels book out fast after lottery results. Many camp at Lyon County Fairgrounds (RV hookups available). ESU residence halls sometimes available. Nearby towns like Olpe, Americus have options. HotelPlanner is official partner.
logistics.food: Emporia has standard restaurant/grocery options. Race week features expo food, pasta dinners. Finish line party with beer garden on Commercial Street.
logistics.packet_pickup: Thursday-Friday at All Things Gravel Expo in downtown Emporia. Photo ID required.
logistics.parking: Downtown streets close race day. Park legally nearby. The start is at Granada Theatre on Commercial Street.
logistics.camping: - Consider splitting accommodations (4 people = ~$105/night per person)

history.founder: Added to Dirty Kanza lineup as 100-mile option
history.origin_story: Introduced in 2013 as a 'launchpad' to the flagship 200-mile event. Quickly became a race in its own right, attracting serious competition and riders who want the Unbound experience in a single-day format. Rebranded with Unbound name in 2021.
notable_moments: 2021: Rebranded to Unbound Gravel with rest of event
2023: Brutal mud conditions test all distances
2024: Elliott Barring wins men's in 4:56:30 sprint finish
history.reputation: The perfect entry point to Unboundâ€”all the suffering you can handle before graduating to the 200.

course_description.character: A 100-mile test through the Kansas Flint Hills. Leaves Emporia traveling north through Wabaunsee and Morris Counties. One checkpoint at Council Grove (~mile 50). Same brutal flint rock roads, rolling terrain, and open prairie as the 200â€”just compressed into a faster, more intense package.

suffering_zones.label: Welcome to Flint
suffering_zones.desc: The smooth pavement ends. Chunky flint begins. Your tires start their battle for survival.

suffering_zones.label: Heat Rising
suffering_zones.desc: Mid-morning on open prairie. Zero shade. The humidity climbs with the sun.

suffering_zones.label: Council Grove Checkpoint
suffering_zones.desc: Your only oasis. Refuel, refill, repair. Everything after this is on you.

suffering_zones.label: The Long Road Home
suffering_zones.desc: 25 miles from aid, heat at peak, legs questioning choices. Where the race is won or lost.

course_description.signature_challenge: The combination of tire-destroying flint, Kansas heat, and self-sufficiency with only one checkpoint. Simple but relentless.

primary.name: Schwalbe G-One Ultrabite
primary.why: high puncture protection for sharp surfaces. excellent wet grip. strong mud clearance

primary.name: Tufo Gravel Swampero
primary.why: excellent wet grip. strong mud clearance

primary.name: Schwalbe G-One Overland
primary.why: high puncture protection for sharp surfaces. excellent wet grip. strong mud clearance

videos.title: 2025 Life Time UNBOUND Gravel presented by Shimano Race Highlights
videos.description:
Watch the full Race Highlights of the 2025 Life Time Grand Prixâ€™s second stop at Life Time UNBOUND Gravel presented by Shimano. With the fastest gravel riders on the planet and unexpected twists and turns throughout the whole day, there was no telling what was coming next.
 
From the womenâ€™s 4-up sprint between Sofia Gomez Villafane, Rosa Kloser, Cecile Lejeune, and Lauren De Crescenzo to two new north course records being broken, race day in Emporia was absolutely buzzing. 
 
Unexpected breakaways, historic records, wrong turns, and so much moreâ€¦ 
 
ðŸŽ¥ Watch now and follow along as the 2025 Life Time Grand Prix unfolds. 
 
Official podium jersey brought to you by Pas Normal Studios. 
 
Learn more about the Life Time Grand Prix: lifetimegrandprix.com 
Learn more about Life Time UNBOUND Gravel presented by Shimano: unboundgravel.com

videos.title: Charlotte man wins, breaks record on 350-mile cycling race
videos.description:
A Charlotte man is back in the Queen City after winning the 350-mile Unbound Gravel bike race with a record-breaking time of 20:17:19. 

"The course is slightly different every year but it always starts and ends in Emporia, Kansas," said William Harrison. "And previously the record was somewhere around 22 or 23 hours so I took a couple of hours off that time."

Jane Monreal learns more from him: https://www.wcnc.com/article/news/local/william-harrison-charlotte-nc-cyclist-sports-local/275-e9bfb45e-2452-4036-aedb-32737cad7507

videos.title: 2024 UNBOUND Gravel | RACE HIGHLIGHTS
videos.description:
Saddle up for extended highlights of the historic 2024 Life Time UNBOUND Gravel. This year's race saw the deepest field in the history of gravel cycling as riders from around the world descended upon Emporia, KS, for the World's Premiere Gravel Race. 

Learn more about the Life Time Grand Prix: https://www.lifetimegrandprix.com

Learn more about Life Time UNBOUND Gravel: https://www.unboundgravel.com/

After 6 months of preparation, I've
finally made it to Unbound, the toughest
gravel race in the world.
[Music]
I've done over 350 hours worth of
training, and I'm here to race the pros.
All that stands between me and the
finish line is 200 miles of the most
brutal gravel terrain.
But can I actually finish it? And do I
stand any chance of a good result? Well,
there's only one way to find out. Yeah.
Well, good luck and I hope as well and
um yeah, to speak to you at the end.
Me versus Unbound.
Unbound takes place in Emporia, Kansas,
Midwest America. Famous for its epic
distance, unforgiving terrain, searing
heat, and full gas racing, which
combined together make this the toughest
and most iconic gravel race in the
world. And in a few days time, I'm going
